rules.natural: Either the survivor sees the mountain or the survivor hears water.
Whenever the survivor hears water, then if the survivor is not in the wilderness, the survivor does not have a knife.
If the survivor reads the map, then given that the survivor has a map, the survivor avoids getting lost.
In the event that the survivor builds a fire, the survivor does not get lost.
Should the survivor signal for rescue, then the survivor does not get lost.
If the survivor gathers wood, then the survivor builds a fire.
Either the survivor gathers wood or the survivor uses a mirror.
Provided that the survivor uses a mirror, the survivor signals for rescue.
If the survivor has an axe, then it is not the case that the survivor has a knife.

If the survivor follows the river, then whenever it is not the case that (if the survivor is not in the wilderness then the survivor lacks navigation skill) implies the survivor has a GPS device, the survivor reaches the camp.

In the event that the survivor climbs the hill, then provided that it is not the case that (if the survivor is not in the wilderness then the survivor lacks navigation skill) implies the survivor has a GPS device, the survivor reaches the camp.
The survivor gets lost or (the survivor follows the river or the survivor climbs the hill).
The survivor finds shelter or the survivor does not get lost.
If it is not the case that (if the survivor sees the mountain then (if the survivor is not in the wilderness then the survivor does not have a knife)), then the survivor panics.
If it is not the case that (if the survivor is not in the wilderness then the survivor lacks navigation skill), then the survivor does not have a GPS device.
Should the survivor not be in the wilderness, then the survivor has a knife.
If the survivor is not in the wilderness, then the survivor has an axe.
Provided that the survivor is not in the wilderness, the survivor has navigation skill.

facts.natural: It is not the case that the survivor panics.
The survivor does not reach the camp.
It is not the case that the survivor finds shelter.

target.natural: The survivor is in the wilderness.

(A10 → (¬G → ¬A1)).natural: If the survivor sees the mountain, then provided that the survivor is not in the wilderness, it is not the case that the survivor has a knife.

(A10 ∨ A11).natural: Either the survivor sees the mountain or the survivor hears water.

(A11 → (¬G → ¬A1)).natural: Whenever the survivor hears water, then if the survivor is not in the wilderness, the survivor does not have a knife.

(A13 → ¬A8).natural: Provided that the survivor has a map, the survivor does not get lost.

(A14 → (A13 → ¬A8)).natural: If the survivor reads the map, then given that the survivor has a map, the survivor avoids getting lost.

(A15 → ¬A8).natural: In the event that the survivor builds a fire, the survivor does not get lost.

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: The survivor builds a fire or the survivor signals for rescue.

(A16 → ¬A8).natural: Should the survivor signal for rescue, then the survivor does not get lost.

(A17 → A15).natural: If the survivor gathers wood, then the survivor builds a fire.

(A17 ∨ A18).natural: Either the survivor gathers wood or the survivor uses a mirror.

(A18 → A16).natural: Provided that the survivor uses a mirror, the survivor signals for rescue.

(A2 → ¬A1).natural: If the survivor has an axe, then it is not the case that the survivor has a knife.

(A6 → (¬(¬(¬G → ¬A3) → A4) → A5)).natural: If the survivor follows the river, then whenever it is not the case that (if the survivor is not in the wilderness then the survivor lacks navigation skill) implies the survivor has a GPS device, the survivor reaches the camp.

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: The survivor follows the river or the survivor climbs the hill.

(A7 → (¬(¬(¬G → ¬A3) → A4) → A5)).natural: In the event that the survivor climbs the hill, then provided that it is not the case that (if the survivor is not in the wilderness then the survivor lacks navigation skill) implies the survivor has a GPS device, the survivor reaches the camp.

(A8 ∨ (A6 ∨ A7)).natural: The survivor gets lost or (the survivor follows the river or the survivor climbs the hill).

(A9 ∨ ¬A8).natural: The survivor finds shelter or the survivor does not get lost.

(¬(A10 → (¬G → ¬A1)) → A12).natural: If it is not the case that (if the survivor sees the mountain then (if the survivor is not in the wilderness then the survivor does not have a knife)), then the survivor panics.

(¬(¬(¬G → ¬A3) → A4) → A5).natural: If it is not the case that (if the survivor is not in the wilderness then the survivor lacks navigation skill) implies the survivor has a GPS device, then the survivor reaches the camp.

(¬(¬G → ¬A3) → A4).natural: Provided that it is not the case that (if the survivor is not in the wilderness then the survivor lacks navigation skill), the survivor has a GPS device.

(¬(¬G → ¬A3) → ¬A4).natural: If it is not the case that (if the survivor is not in the wilderness then the survivor lacks navigation skill), then the survivor does not have a GPS device.

(¬G → A1).natural: Should the survivor not be in the wilderness, then the survivor has a knife.

(¬G → A2).natural: If the survivor is not in the wilderness, then the survivor has an axe.

(¬G → A3).natural: Provided that the survivor is not in the wilderness, the survivor has navigation skill.

(¬G → ¬A1).natural: In the event that the survivor is not in the wilderness, then the survivor does not have a knife.

(¬G → ¬A3).natural: If the survivor is not in the wilderness, then it is not the case that the survivor has navigation skill.

G.natural: The survivor is in the wilderness.
